Doesn't Duskblade add Pen on-top of Raw AD on top of an AA passive? 

I don't understand how Luden's adds more damage to a kits rotation then Dusk.

It’s a sweeping claim and there are bound to be exceptions... but most mages will have 3-4 abilities that scale on ap. Most ad champs have an ability or two that don’t scale or are utility only. Also generally ap ratios are higher than ad. Finally the raw ap stat is higher. The lethality is only going to increase damage about 10% and the 60 extra ap vs the ad on dusk will add more dps.

Are AP Ratio's higher then AD ratio's? 

Off the top of my head alone I can know for a fact that LOTS of AD champions have spells that scale much higher than those of what could considered their AP Counterparts. Add on top of that AD adds to Basic Attacks and not just Abilities.

You need to take into account what clarifies as a rotation PER CHAMPION.

The highest AP ratio in the Game belongs to Annie is around 500% whereas the highest AD belongs to like MF or something around 1500%. 

But you need to take into account that MF's rotation WILL guarantee included AA's and Annie's won't. 

I think it's a little TOO BROAD a claim to say Luden's adds more damage to a rotation then Dusk.

The bigger problem is that tanks can't soak damage now.  It used to be the case that a 1v1 tank versus assassin strongly favored the tank, even if the assassin was somewhat ahead.  Now most assassins, with their standard builds, can usually win a 1v1 versus the tank.  

The only tanks that do remotely well now are those that succeed by building damage or by dominating lane.  No tanks do well because of how they soak damage in teamfights.  

We are in an assassin meta and tanks still suck.  That should be an alarm for RIOT.

Stop apologizing for AD assassins. Talon gets more ability damage from one longsword than any mage gets from an Amp Tome, unless their combo has higher than 3.05 AP ratio. If you equalize for damage per gold, mages only break even once their total AP ratio hits 3.8. 

I don't think your mind will be changed by showing you the math, nor do I think you'll look it up yourself. Suffice it to say, AD mids have *vastly* higher base effective health than mages and get *vastly* more damage scaling from early recalls than mages. I did the math once, and if Lux spammed E on Zed without missing from full to zero mana with typical starting stats, the Zed would not die. 

Seeker's doesn't stop Zed or Talon from killing you 100-0 with a Dirk. Why? Because they don't even *need* the lethality with how much damage they get from base + ratios. And Ignite is dealing 25%+ of a mage's health bar from level 1-18, and armor isn't doing shit against that.
